name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The good news is that Trump wants to bring the country together. The bad news is, that country is Germany in 1933.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: What else does this man have to do for people to see what he is? Grow the mustache?

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The only supporters Trump has in New York is the army of ass-kissers who fly in from Washington every day to suckle his teats on camera. Today it was Don Jr, Sebastian Gorka, Ronny Jackson, and Joe Piscopo. Not exactly a Beatles reunion.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: ‘And my dad screwed both of them!'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Many analysts on Wall Street say they haven’t seen losses like this since every other time Trump has run a business.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Truth Social has now lost so much money, they may have to change their name to Red Lobster.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It’s as invisible as Rudy Giuliani in front of a mirror.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: But if it gets nominated for an Oscar he’ll start saying he wrote it.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Apparently MAGA now means Make America Germany Around 1938.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Thats not a dogwhistle, thats a whistle made of dog.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Yes, they didn’t see it. It’s a simple case of not-see.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: They should know it’s wrong to blame a staffer when you get caught doing something fascist. You’re supposed to blame Sam Alito’s wife.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Today was Trump’s chance to wake up, snort a line of gas station energy powder, and get on that stand to prove that this is all a big Joe Biden witch hunt. But it is now confirmed that Donald Trump will not testify. That is shocking. Trump is not talking. What happened, did he write himself a check for 130 thousand dollars?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Today, testimony ended in the first ever criminal trial of a former President of the United States. Now it may not have been the Trump trial we all wanted. It may not be about his most hideous crimes. But, dammit [takes off glasses for emphasis] at least he farted. They can never take that away from us.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I swear to God this trial is making me dumber.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: To quote the porn version of Romeo and Juliet , Boneo and Screwliet : “‘Hark, what light through yonder buttcrack breaks. ‘Tis the pizza man, but how shall we pay him? Uh oh, I’m all out of ducats.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: the most successful sex capsule salesman in Idaho, Utah, and Nevada

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: After calling just two witnesses this afternoon, Trump’s defense rested. Of course, Trump himself is fully rested.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: First of all, ha ha. Second of all, how could they be losing money? Doesn’t every business want to associate their product with the Unified Reich?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: There a 5-year-old on YouTube making more than that unboxing Go-Gurt.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: The official reason Red Lobster gave for filing [for bankruptcy] was ‘financial and operational challenges.’ Namely, that it’s hard to run a business when your hands are wrapped up in those little rubber bands.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: If the bet is on how much Americans can eat, always take the over.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Now listen, I know that sounds terrible… [long pause before moving on to next joke]

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: When they saw the ad, even Confederate statues were like, ‘You should take that down.'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: He wanted to take the stand, but then he saw it was three steps without a handrail.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: These are crazy times. Biden campaigned from his basement because of Covid, now Trump might have to do the same because of house arrest.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Peloton is barely hanging on. Now when you ride your bike you have to give a motivational pep talk to the instructor.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: On the bright side, you can now clean up after your dog by using a magnet.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Growing up my family didn’t have a lot of money so we could only afford above-ground cocaine.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Its just so peculiar that, outside the courtroom with his legal pads full of notes, he just talks and talks and talks. But then if you ask him to walk just a few feet inside the courtroom and to swear to tell the truth under penalty of law, suddenly he’s afraid to speak? I mean, what’s the difference? Is it the fluorescent lighting? I mean, I hate to come to this conclusion, but is it possible that Donald Trump is full of sh*t?” michael kosta

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: What? After talking such a big game he’s not testifying? So he’s doing the opposite of what he told us he was gonna do over and over and over again? That’s not the Donald Trump I know, and I played full-contact hockey without a helmet this morning.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Goddamn, I mean, served at his own birthday party. Could you imagine, you know? ‘Hey could someone take a picture of me taunting the Arizona court? Yeah, how about you, man in a suit and a badge at my birthday party that I’ve never seen before?'

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: I just can’t believe he called it Rudy’s Coffee and not Ground Zero.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Why is it you only see right-wing grifters hawking these these cheap products? Rudy’s coffee, Alex Jones’ supplements, Donald Trump’s… everything.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: This is not acceptable. Open AI should be punished for attempting to steal ScarJo’s voice. In fact, from now on they should have to use an off-putting voice. Like my uncle Dan who’s been smoking his whole life.
